lines.content: ### Helix Chatbot: Your Personal Task Manager

Helix is a simple, intuitive, and interactive chatbot designed to help you manage your tasks efficiently. Whether you're adding to-dos, setting deadlines, or planning events, Helix is here to assist you every step of the way.
- Add tasks to your task list (To-Dos, Deadlines, Events).
- Mark tasks as completed or unmark them.
- Delete tasks when no longer needed.
- View a list of all your tasks.
- Exit the chatbot with a friendly farewell message.
- A terminal or an IDE like IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse, or VS Code.
Here are the commands you can use with Helix:
| `todo <description>` | Adds a simple to-do task. Example: `todo Read a book`                   |
| `deadline <description> /by <due date>` | Adds a task with a deadline. Example: `deadline Submit report /by 2025-01-30` |
| `event <description> /from <start time> /to <end time>` | Adds an event task. Example: `event Team meeting /from 10am /to 12pm` |
| `list`        | Displays all the tasks in your list.                                        |
| `mark <task number>` | Marks the specified task as done. Example: `mark 1`                      |
| `unmark <task number>` | Marks the specified task as not done. Example: `unmark 1`              |
| `delete <task number>` | Deletes the specified task. Example: `delete 1`                       |

helixSymbol + " [Helix] : What can I do for you today?\n"
warningSymbol + " [Helix] : An unexpected error occurred. Please try again."
* A command to add a task to the TaskList.
* Constructs an AddCommand with the specified task.
* @param task the task to be added
* Executes the add command by adding the task to the TaskList.
* @param taskList the TaskList to which the task will be added
System.out.println("\nYou now have " + taskList.getTaskCount() + " task(s) in your list.");
* Abstract base class representing a generic command.
* Commands are executable actions that operate on a TaskList.
* Constructs a new Command with the specified {@link CommandType}.
* @param commandType the type of the command
* Retrieves the {@link CommandType} of this command.
* Executes the command on the specified TaskList.
* @param taskList the TaskList on which the command will operate
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList) throws HelixException;
* Determines whether the application should continue or terminate after executing the command.
* @return {@code ExecutionStatus.CONTINUE} to continue or {@code ExecutionStatus.EXIT} to terminate.
* Factory class for creating Command instances based on user input.
* Creates a {@link Command} based on the given input.
* @param input the user input specifying the type of command
* @return a {@link Command} instance corresponding to the input
* @throws InvalidCommandException if the input command type is invalid
* @throws HelixException if the command is invalid or contains improper arguments
public static Command createCommand(String input) throws HelixException {
* Creates a {@link Todo} command after validating arguments.
* @param args the arguments for the {@code todo} command (task description)
* @return a {@link Command} instance for adding a {@link Todo} task
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the description is missing
* @throws TooManyArgumentsException if the command contains too many arguments
private static Command createTodoCommand(String args) throws HelixException {
* Creates a {@link Deadline} command after validating arguments.
* @param args the arguments for the {@code deadline} command, which must include
*             a description and a due date separated by {@code /by}
* @return a {@link Command} instance for adding a {@link Deadline} task
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the arguments are missing or improperly formatted
* @throws TooManyArgumentsException if the command contains too many arguments
private static Command createDeadlineCommand(String args) throws HelixException {
return new AddCommand(CommandType.DEADLINE, new Deadline(details[0].trim(), details[1].trim()));
* Creates an {@link Event} command after validating arguments.
* @param args the arguments for the {@code event} command, which must include
*             a description, a start time (specified using {@code /from}),
* @return a {@link Command} instance for adding an {@link Event} task
* @throws MissingArgumentException if the arguments are missing or improperly formatted
* @throws TooManyArgumentsException if the command contains too many arguments
private static Command createEventCommand(String args) throws HelixException {
return new AddCommand(CommandType.EVENT, new Event(details[0].trim(), times[0].trim(), times[1].trim()));
* The list command is used to display all tasks currently in the task list.
* @param args the arguments for the {@code list} command (should be empty)
* @return a {@link Command} instance for listing all tasks
* @throws TooManyArgumentsException if the command contains unnecessary arguments
private static Command createListCommand(String args) throws HelixException {
* The exit command is used to terminate the chatbot session.
* @param args the arguments for the {@code bye} command (should be empty)
* @return a {@link Command} instance for exiting the application
* @throws TooManyArgumentsException if the command contains unnecessary arguments
private static Command createExitCommand(String args) throws HelixException {

* @throws InvalidNumberFormatException if the task number is not a valid positive integer
* @throws TooManyArgumentsException if the command contains too many arguments
private static Command createMarkCommand(String args) throws HelixException {

* Base class for all Helix-related exceptions.
public abstract class HelixException extends Exception {
* Constructs a HelixException with the specified error message.
* Returns a user-friendly string representation of the exception.
* @return a formatted string with the exception message
* Exception thrown when an invalid command is entered.
* Constructs an {@code InvalidCommandException} with a default message
* prompting the user to check the list of valid commands.
super("Invalid command. Type 'help' for a list of commands.");
* Exception thrown when an invalid number is provided as input.
* Constructs an {@code InvalidNumberFormatException} with a default error message.
super("Invalid input. Please enter a number.");
* Constructs an {@code InvalidNumberFormatException} with a custom error message.
* @param message the custom error message to be displayed
* Exception thrown when a command is missing required arguments.
* Constructs a {@code MissingArgumentException} with the specific command
* name and an example format to guide the user.
* @param command       the name of the command missing required arguments (e.g., "todo", "deadline")
* @param exampleFormat an example format showing the correct syntax for the command
super("The command '" + command + "' requires additional arguments. " +
* Exception thrown when a task index is out of bounds.
* Constructs a TaskIndexOutOfBoundsException with a detailed error message.
* @param index the index that was invalid
* @param size  the size of the task list
super("Task number " + index + " does not exist. You only have " + size + " task(s) in your list.");
* Exception thrown when a command has more arguments than expected.
* Constructs a {@code TooManyArgumentsException} with a default error message.
super("Too many arguments provided. Please check the command format.");
* Constructs a {@code TooManyArgumentsException} with a custom error message.
* @param exampleFormat an example of the correct command format
super("The command '" + command + "' received too many arguments. " +
* Represents a deadline task with a description and a due date.

* Gets additional details specific to a Deadline task.

* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A formatted string representing the Deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a description, start time, and end time.
private final String from; // Start time of the event
private final String to;   // End time of the event
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from        The start time of the event.
* @param to          The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {

* @return A string describing the start and end times of the event.
return clockSymbol + " From: " + this.from + "\n  " + clockSymbol + " To: " + this.to;
* Returns the string representation of the Event task.
* @return A formatted string representing the Event task.
return "[" + TaskType.EVENT.getCode() + "]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Abstract base class representing a generic task.
* Task contains a description and a completion status.
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.

* Marks the task as done by setting the completion status to true.
* Marks the task as not done by setting the completion status to false.
* Retrieves the description of the task.

* @return the status of the task (PENDING or COMPLETED)
* Returns the type of the task. To be overridden by subclasses.
* @return the type of the task as a TaskType Enum
* Returns task-specific details. To be overridden by subclasses.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its completion status.
* @return the string representation of the task
* Represents a todo task with a description.
* Constructs a Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the todo task.
* Gets the type of the task.
* @return A TaskType enum representing the type of the task (TODO).
* Gets additional details specific to a Todo task.
* @return An empty string as Todo tasks have no additional details.
return ""; // No additional details for a Todo task
* Returns the string representation of the Todo task.
